Review.Titre: I was unable to purchase 5 tickets
Review.Contenu: I was unable to purchase 5 tickets, because there were only groups of three remaining for purchase. Due to their policy, you cannot orphan a seat, which means I couldn't purchase less than 6 seats. I thought considering there was no other option to purchase a group of 5 seats they would reconsider their policy for the sale. But they gave me the run around via email and phone for two days, I repeatedly asked to speak to someone who could help me book the tickets, but was sluffed off. I asked twice to speak to a manager and they never provided any contact for a manager and no manager contacted me. I give up, both of our losses they lose a 5 ticket sale, and we don't get to see the event. :(

Review.Titre: Too much work, too many hoops, too many added charges for no work on their part. I'm out. For good.
Review.Contenu: I like that this prompt begins with the line "Tell is what went wrong this time." Well, exactly. I'm used to dealing with Ticketmaster's arrogant, monopoly-driven, AI-reliant way of doing business, and their service charges for no work on their part, so I went in with my eyes open, fully expecting to be annoyed at some point but prepared to deal with it. Even I was surprised, though, by the sheer number of hoops their system demanded I go through — even demanding that I change my password at one point, then making it difficult for me to do that, and then blocking me from proceeding further. I will not be treated that way anymore. Goodbye Ticketmaster. I'm out. You're done. End of.

The seats were incredibly uncomfortable and it became quickly irritating to have to keep getting up and leaving the seat isle every time someone wanted to get through. The show itself was kind of lacklustre. The volume of the movie I felt wasn’t loud enough and the live orchestra, the part I was looking  forward to and obviously the reason why we paid a lot more money to see the movie, didn’t really add to the experience of the movie. I actually forgot there was a live orchestra playing because it just sounded like it was regular music from the movie. I get that the orchestra wanted to blend in with the movie but I had hoped that it would have been more obvious of a difference…and for me there wasn’t. We ended up leaving during intermission. I would never spend the extra money to see a movie with a live orchestra okaying again. I found there to be no difference and I walked away upset that I paid $150 to basically watch a movie.

Booking was painful. I found the website difficult to navigate. I was kicked off the site twice & when I pulled up the site again it wouldn't load.And then all the instructions to view the tickets which I didn't do. That was a nightmare on the an actual day & I am  not willing to load more apps on my phone. I would have appreciated receiving the QR code like every other does where I buy tickets.

Review.Titre: It was extremely difficult to pick…
Review.Contenu: It was extremely difficult to pick tickets from the map only to find out someone else had already claimed the seats.Then why was it shown as available on the map.this happened numerous times, very frustrating as you loose seats and time, especially when the tickets are selling out fast !

Review.Titre: I tested positive for Covid and was…
Review.Contenu: I tested positive for Covid and was unable to refund or resell my ticket so I didn’t get to go. Even though I bet a lot of people were there with Covid because only ticketmaster and stubhub can resell tickets for triple the price. I would have done face value or less. Frankly I hate ticketmaster and hope you go out of business

Review.Titre: I purchased 3 adult tickets by accident…
Review.Contenu: I purchased 3 adult tickets by accident as I was bringing 2 girls, 11 & 12.    I contacted ticketmaster immediately but there were no help at all.   so I had to keep the adult tickets I had

Well I have a cell but do not use it often I purchased four tickets and could not give them away I had to go to Rama a four hour drive to get my ticket do you not realize not everyone has a phone or email ! I asked for the tickets to be sent by Canada post and they would not do this so this will be my last dealing with ticket master

I bought tickets for my 84 year old mom to see her favourite show. I realized after I bought them that they were “obstructed view”,and it was indicated, however, the font is not obvious enough. In this day and age there should be a flashing window or something drawing your attention to this before you buy. Instead, you get stuck with tickets that can’t be refunded. Shame. You make enough money that you don’t need to push these tickets out with “no refund or exchange.”

Review.Titre: Ticket master changed the seats I…
Review.Contenu: Ticket master changed the seats I bought. I was not told this until after waiting in the rain with 2 daughters (one still an infant) for 20 mins to get in. The lady told me I needed to see the ticket window. Back in rain around the corner, match almost starting, told my seats have had to be changed, no reason given, still standing in rain, ticket window lady tells me I need to wait as her supervisor was in the bathroom, still waiting, 10 mins go by, this sucks, supervisor comes out and prints four new tickets, still no reason, back to waiting in rain to enter, 15 mins later we get in, our seats are on the opposite side of the field than the ones I specifically purchased for a reason. National anthems are played, missed yhem and kick off. Thanks ticketmaster, still waiting for a reason.

Terrible experience. My daughters and I had looked forward to this concert for months. The sound was so off that we spent most of the first half covering our ears. Singers voices couldn’t be made out and were distorted or not heard at all. It was so loud the reverberation and drums were deafening. We ended up leaving after the intermission because we couldn’t stand it any longer.
These tickets re-sold through ticketmaster on November 9th and I am still waiting for the money to be deposited into my Verified account. You are ripping off your customers!

The tickets were not visible with the link provided in the email. The app was not possible to download since you then need an apple id in canada. I am from eu.In the we had to go to the arena 2 hrs before and got the tickets finally

Review.Titre: Unfortunately my son got Covid and we…
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately my son got Covid and we were unable to attend.

Review.Titre: We love Cirques, but we were disappointed with this one.
Review.Contenu: Well, we bought tickets thinking it would be like the Cirque's we've seen in the past; however it was came across more like a circus with not much new or exciting to watch in our opinion.  We felt it was like a show you might see for free while visiting Disney Land or Sea World. The male duo team was entertaining and impressive, otherwise, we were a bit disappointed with the overall experience.  Perhaps our fault for not doing our research on it before buying tickets.  I think kids would enjoy the show.

Our seats were triple booked! We arrived 25 minutes early to find people were in our seats! While I was waiting to tell the usher I realized he was also dealing with people who were also inquiring about people who were in their seats (which were also my seats!!!). We ended up finding empty seats 6 rows above our original row. If this matter can be looked into we would appreciate it. Our tickets were section 13, row N, seat 4,5,6.  I’m very disappointed with the ticket master process. We now pay big service fees to ticket master to book….over booking should never occur!!!

Review.Titre: Multiple Ticketmaster websites using same login but they're actually different
Review.Contenu: 1) fees are too high and make no sense (service fee is some percentage of the ticket price?)2) got emails from both Ticketmaster and Broadway across Canada regarding downloading my ticket. Both went to Ticketmaster sites (I didn't realize they were different) but only one had my ticket while the other one (despite using the same login) said I had no upcoming events. This was very alarming.

Review.Titre: The show was rescheduled without notice
Review.Contenu: The show was rescheduled, I never received any email about the new date. I showed up with my out of town guest to the venue (along with~40-50 other people who also did not get an email). I sought compensation from Ticketmaster for my guest's missed work and twice the fuel and Ticketmaster was not helpful putting the blame solely on me. (November 2, 2023 was the original date)

Review.Titre: Lack of printing option is very…
Review.Contenu: Lack of printing option is very inconvenient in the case of those without a phone, no data, or if battery dies. Having the phone option is great, however forcing everyone to use it is constrictive and leads to possible inconvenient experiences. Weird being "ticketmaster" without any physical tangible tickets anymore. Would be happy if both options existed, as of now there were too many hassles with getting through the gates even with all of us having phones and the app.. brand damaging.

Review.Titre: Ticketmaster and BMO Field need to do BETTER!
Review.Contenu: Ticketmaster should have a vested interest in ensuring the venues have adequate capacity to get fans into the venue. Unfortunately, though arriving 30 mins before kick-off for the game, I wasn't able to get into the stadium until the game was already 25 mins into the half. That is to say, it took about 60 mins for me to get through the gate. I heard a lot of "never doing this again" in the line-ups about whether people would attend games. I would imagine that's not in Ticketmaster's interest. You need to work with BMO Field to get this issue sorted out.

Review.Titre: Last minute my wife couldn't make the…
Review.Contenu: Last minute my wife couldn't make the concert and I was unable to sell her ticket. I actually wound up giving it away. I had asked for help from your "chatbot" and the next day I got a response saying things were busy and you were sorry for being unable to help me.If you want to help and there is a real person looking at this please tell me how much I originally paid for my two tickets and the date of the transaction...That would help

Review.Titre: Wasn't allowed to reduce the price of…
Review.Contenu: Wasn't allowed to reduce the price of my extra ticket below the Ticketmaster set price,l which was rather high

Review.Titre: Research the venue and do your best to figure out what section is even acceptable for acoustics.
Review.Contenu: This is probably my own fault: Saw Tool at Scotiabank Arena in Toronto. Was excited to finally see one of my favourite bands. Realized quickly that the section I was sitting in had absolutely horrendous acoustics. Tried with and without earplugs but no luck. I was extremely disappointed and left after 3 songs, (I couldn't believe I was doing that) deciding I'd rather not even see this amazing band at all than to see and hear them with such terrible acoustics. I read afterwards that it might be possible to go to guest services at the venue and change your seating but I didn't know that at the time. Again - a ton of blame on my end, but moral of the story, do your research on section seating where at all possible.Sat in section 119, Row 28

Review.Titre: could not log into the wifes existing…
Review.Contenu: could not log into the wifes existing account, she has not changed her password so we had to set up a new account under my name.the seats we tried to reserve through the angels foundation account got tied up and we had to wait until they were release again.overall the ticketmaster process took us over an hour to get the tickets, it was extremely frustrating.

This was the most disappointing event, due to seating, that I have ever gone to.  I am new to the area so I called your Customer Service, before purchasing the tickets, was advised that Section 54 was a very good choice for seating.  We were so excited to go to see Come From Away.  We looked at the back of peoples heads the whole show.  I will never book another event that is being held at the Scotiabank Centre.

Review.Titre: Will never purchase tickets through TM
Review.Contenu: Will never purchase tickets through Ticketmaster. The worst experience ever. TM website has an average of 7.5-8.0 rating; I give it a BIG FAT ZERO. Too many links routed to scammers, especially when the scammer is asking for funds in US dollars. Let's get back to old school, just order your tickets from the place of the show, or pick them up at the venue's ticket office. It is that simple.

Review.Titre: Line Up to get in was ridiculous.
Review.Contenu: Arrived at 7:20pm at the entrance. Line up was so long we didn’t get in until half time. The stadium should have waited for a certain percent of the audience to be inside before starting game. So disappointing. Never had this issue before and we’ve been to sooo many games. Even the sold out CANWNT game in was not like this.
Should have option for paper/printed tickets for old people like me.

Review.Titre: Please allow re-entry for kids shows
Review.Contenu: Please allow re-entry for kids shows - my daughter had to leave the venue briefly before the show started but we were not allowed back in, so we missed the entire show

The event apparently was a 19+ event but it was not clearly identified as such during the purchase process. As someone who does not purchase tickets all that often, they could have been a much better job identifying this to potential purchasers.We travelled 1.5 hours to get the event only to be told at the door it was 19+ only and with no recourse had to leave the event and be out of pocket, not see the band and then drive 1.5 hours back home.Horrible experience all around.

Review.Titre: We were very disappointed with our…
Review.Contenu: We were very disappointed with our tickets for Pete Davidson.  We arrived 30 minutes early, the admission line took a very long time to get through. There needs to be a more effective way of admission.  The line up was so long we missed 25 minutes of the show despite arriving 30 minutes early.  It seems a bit unfair that we paid for our tickets, arrived on time yet missed the beginning of the show!

Takes too long to get to your tickets on your phone... and ticketmaster are total scamers....tickets are out of price..it s freekin riddicilus....the government should seriously look into your resale policies....you are leading to a population more and more unable to have access to culture....

Review.Titre: Ticketmaster is a monopoly on the…
Review.Contenu: Ticketmaster is a monopoly on the industry and the only real way to get tickets to most major events in North America.
The description was not accurate.  They played the movie with subtitles and the orchestra played along. No narrator, no introductions nothing super disappointing for the amount we paid.

Review.Titre: digital tix with no print option give ticketmaster license to sell the cell number
Review.Contenu: The concert was fabulous, the venue perfect, the staff at the venue ideal.  My complaint is specifically related to the digital - and digital only - ticket policy.My cell 'phone use is limited in the extreme.  Yet, almost immediately after "having to" purchase a digital ticket with no print option, the junk and spam calls on my cell 'phone exploded.  Every week from time of purchase to concert day: anywhere from 8 - 15 attempts to contact me from people and companies I do not know and certainly did not have my number.You do the math.

Review.Titre: The show influenced by crew bus…
Review.Contenu: Show was day after bus accident. The impact of the accident evident through out the show. No introduction of band or crew. Sound quality not great. Seemed like a lot of lip syncing   Disappointed in show. Entry and exit into building -delays. Traffic management poor. Vendors and service at event great

Review.Titre: We should be allowed to resell tickets…
Review.Contenu: We should be allowed to resell tickets we purchased for less than we paid for them.It is not scalping. The fact that when I tried to sell them, Ticketmaster would only allow a price higher than what I paid for them. I was not able to go due to a family emergency and wanted to offer them for less money so someone Gould go and enjoy the game. Disgusting!!

Advertised as concert. Actually "Movie with live music track and vocals, no live dance" Waste of time and money. Prices kept dropping, feel sorry for those who paid full ticket price. Definitely misleading.

I purchased tickets to Charlie Puth in June, the VIP package, it is now November 14th and I still have not received my VIP merchandise.  Ticketmaster keeps advising me to wait to hear from them.   They will not refund me the cost of the merchandise.   All my friends that were at the show received their merchandise.  Ticketmaster Canada is awful and customer service!

You basically stole my ticket Got them a month ago then my friend cancel so i had to put them for sale on your platform I try to cancel the sale maby 3h before the show because i found someone Everytime i try to cancel the sale “around 30 time “ there was a error on your side so basically drove to rogers place for nothing try to get it fix at your little help area at rogers place it was like my ticket did not exist Thx a lot
The one seat of the pair was almost completely obstructed. Should not have been sold unless this was in the description.
Ticket prices (not re-sale) went much lower after I purchased my ticket. No full or partial refunds offered. Punished for being a fan.

Review.Titre: Would not let me sell tickets in an emergency
Review.Contenu: I buy many tickets through you.  This time my friend had to go to emergency and we could not go.  I was unable to put the tickets for resale, even for less than what I paid - so the tickets went to waste and we could not recoup anything.  Very disappointing.

Review.Titre: Ticket master is great at their job
Review.Contenu: Ticket master is great at their job, ripping off consumers and making it easy for people to gouge for floor tickets.

Review.Titre: The biggest disappointment was there…was no seating!
Review.Contenu: The biggest disappointment was there were no seats, standing only. This SHOULD have been disclosed at point of sale!  Will never attend another event at this venue or any other sold by Ticketmaster.

Accessibility into the event was a complete and utter disaster. 45 minutes to get through security is a joke.Missed a lot of the Nickelback set since they were performing on the west side of the stadium, and we were on the east side, so we relied on the big screen to see them. Unfortunately for most of their set we were forced to see the Ticketmaster logo on the big screen. I realized you sponsored Nickelback but didn't you make enough on the event without force feeding us your corporate BS.

I selected my seats. Your website would not allow me to pay for them. Time expired and I lost my seat selection. This happened with several seat selections. By the time your website would accept payment from me, my seats were much further back than my original selection. I still had to pay your administrative charge, despite the poor service. I also don't appreciate being *required* to download your app onto my phone in order to obtain eTickets.

Review.Titre: You have an insecure website with…
Review.Contenu: You have an insecure website with expired certs. You charge exorbitant fees for an entirely self serve process. You strong arm venues and artists into using your services. Tick-tock, enjoy it while you can.

Review.Titre: Scanner at the door would not scan my…
Review.Contenu: Scanner at the door would not scan my tickets from my wallet.  They just let us in anyway.  You should go back to paper tickets for Halifax.  This also happened to me at the Casino scanned 4 of the 5 tickets.  Scanning of tickets does not seem to work.  I find that scanning of tickets slows down entrance into the venue.

Been 100s of shows n this is the first show ive been too thats had a no picture or video rule implemented by a artist. They were throwing people out who paid 100s of dollers per ticket. Maynard hid in the back and all his comments of the 10 words he spoke were negative about Vancouver.  He clearly dosent care about fans money spent on overpriced tickets nor Vancouver.  Would not go again nor recommend them live.

Review.Titre: Ticketmaster failed to report my seats…
Review.Contenu: Ticketmaster failed to report my seats were an obstructive view and my concert was ruined. The ushers tried to assist but the venue was sold out. I'm shocked a company as large as ticketmaster didn't ensure it had all the information for the venue they're selling tickets for. I'm really disappointed

Ticketmaster SUCKS. This is the only time I’ve managed to get tickets, and the experience was stressful. Why let me click on seats I want to purchase and then say “someone already chose these seats”. And the longer you try, the more the prices climb. It’s the worst system ever and ticket master should be ashamed of themselves. Your prices SUCK by the way. Never supporting again.

Review.Titre: Money Gouging as Always on Fees
Review.Contenu: $100  charge on my tickets that is gouging 100%. No wonder no one can have afforded to go to anything when your company does this for what?? Emailing me a ticket , absolutely disheartening and unprofessional

Review.Titre: If General Admission- Don't go there is no seats!!!
Review.Contenu: When buying the tickets I called to ask about seating asnit was listed as General Admission and was told it was not assigned seating. We arrived to no seating at all, no coat check, a mini bar. It was awful, eople were standing around or sitting on the floor with winter coats on their laps. We left after 40 minutes as I was in to much pain to stand anymore. Many walked I  and then turn around and left before the concert even started. Alot of people were mad at not knowing there would be no seats. This is a 55+ crowd, we need seats!!!

Review.Titre: Ticketmaster's monopoly has never flourished more than it does today
Review.Contenu: Ticketmaster has a monopoly on initial ticket sales and has relationships with ticket resellers. Ticketmaster is soulless and its employees are complicit in making sure every major venue and event has a reliable ticket sales operation that puts profit above all. It's a vicious circle that results in the wealthy having access to arts and entertainment while the poor won't. Music and art is about money - ticketmaster ensures this will continue.

We bought vip tickets 4 tickets for the show and 4 vip tickets as 2 sets of 2 attached to 2 different emails and turns out our vip tickets was a huge waste of money as neither of us received notice as to when the vip part started and we completed missed it as when I asked about the vip I was told an hr before the show which would have been 7 as the show started at 8 so we showed up to the venue for 7 and waisted all that money and missed out on the whole vip experience. It was a HUGE let down. We were all very disappointed!

Review.Titre: 14 days since my ticket sold and still…
Review.Contenu: 14 days since my ticket sold and still no money from ticketmaster. When I asked to speak to a supervisor I got hung up on. I called back and was told there is no supervisor there, they will call me back in 48 hours! Ticketmaster has false advertising. Website says you will be payed 5-7 days! Not true!! Beware!!

Review.Titre: 2 tickets on phone only one could scan…
Review.Contenu: 2 tickets on phone only one could scan , 20 min later 2nd ticket scaned ofter numeroums times totext  phones . bring back option for paper tickets

I will never again buy tickets where I am not allowed to print them off for scanning.  The venue had horrible wifi and my connection would not work.  You are discriminating against those who do not want to use an e-wallet.  Shameful.

Review.Titre: Last minute announcements and poorly organized..
Review.Contenu: For starters the communication about the event was not good. People travel for events like this and they left it very last minute to announce no whl game, no alumni game, the pregame concert, and fan venues for pregame experiences. Then we arrived at the venue an hour and 15 minutes early so we could wander and look at merchandise but it took all of that time just to get through Security and into the building. We just got to our seats which were right near the entrance we went in a few minutes before the national anthem started. Once in the venue we went down to use the washroom and the concourse was so jammed with people that you couldn't tell where lines were for anything and we didn't make it back to our seats until over halfway through the second period. All of this time was just trying to get through the jam of people to the stairs up. The game itself was good but just seemed very poorly organized and planned.

Review.Titre: Some one forgot to update the address…
Review.Contenu: Some one forgot to update the address details of the venue. The venue label was correct but the address detail (location) was incorrect and therefore we ended up going to the wrong place. We ended up missing half of the show because of that.

Review.Titre: Wouldn't update the price on my listing…
Review.Contenu: Wouldn't update the price on my listed tickets. Lost $200
Your fees are absolutely ridiculous. Trying to recoup pandemic losses but your patrons all suffered too

Review.Titre: Even though we are partial season ticket…
Review.Contenu: Even though we are partial season ticket holders, we still missed out on meeting any player for an autograph because we were told it was to give the organizers an estimate of how many people would be there and people still lined up without a ticketmaster ticket starting at 730am. My wife felt sad for the second year in a row. Last year it was a different system. The best event in the past had to be when scratch tickets were given out inside the main gate that gave everyone an opportunity to visit atleast one player downstairs near the offices and elevators. Dan Charbeneau is our rep but no response from an email. I expect he is busy.

Review.Titre: Unfortunately I ended up n the hospital…
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately I ended up n the hospital and missed the show.  Your stupid requirement of needing the purchasing credit card and picture ID to pick up the tickets meant my friend couldn't access the tickets so we both missed the show.  Were print at home - or God forbid physical tickets - really that big an issue?

The verified resale......It's Ticketmaster jacking up the cost of tickets.  The greed is astounding.  The average concert-goer/fan cannot afford to go see their favourite artists anymore.  Travis Scott tickets went on sale at 10am.  10:01 there are verified tix on available.  Your telling me that 1 min after someone bought tickets they thought "hey I can't go maybe I should resale them".  Give me a break.  We need another option.  Ridiculous.

Stop allowing “verified resale tickets” on your platform! It drives up prices ridiculously and does not allow honest, hard working fans to take their families to games, events, etc. It’s absolutely incredible you profit both from the sale and then the resale of tickets. I believe this is a terrible practise on your behalf!

Review.Titre: Tickets only accessible via Cell phone - not tenable.hat only a mobile app…
Review.Contenu: Your insistence that only a mobile app on cell phone would be able to receive and hold tickets is ridiculous, insulting and as far from a client service orientation as you can get. Then just try to contact TM, or reach anyone in a reasonable time, and then try to request an alternate ticket delivery and the result is a non starter and rude treatment. What on earth is someone supposed to do if they don't have a cell phone?....there are people in this world in that state....not that TM would appear to care about them.

Purchasing tickets was a frustrating experience. With seats going in and out of availability, clicking on open seats only to then have them be already gone. Took over an hour just to get 2 seats together to stick and get through to pay! Ridiculous. There has to be a better way.

The event was phenomenal.Ticketmaster failed significantly. My app would not activate and open my tickets - I can screen print - so had to go to the box office and have them print.Disgraceful in this day and age.

Review.Titre: SOME OF US DO NOT HAVE CELL PHONES !!!!!
Review.Contenu: Ticketmaster does not make allowance for those of us who DO NOT HAVE A CELL PHONEIt was impossible to get info from a LIVE PERSONHowever Scotiabank Arena box office staff were very helpful and understanding.Andre Rieu concert was WONDERFUL (once we actually were able to get in!)

Review.Titre: Why are there 40% extra in fees?
Review.Contenu: It it was possible to give 0 stars, I would. There is absolutely no reason for a company to change almost 40% of the value of the ticket in bogus fees. A $100 ticket should not cost almost $140 after fees. If I had a choice to buy my ticket elsewhere, I would. But unfortunately ticketmaster has a monopoly so they are able to get away with charging whatever ridiculous fees they want. It’s a terrible thing to do.

Terrible seats!  Positioned behind two pillars.  We had to cock our heads left or right or look through the 3” between the pillars.  Shame on Ticketmaster for not making ticket buyers aware that seats are obstructed.
The Fear Inoculum VIP Experience was poor.  I - along with everyone else I interacted with in the VIP Experience - felt ripped off.
The sound wasn't good. The PA system was clipping and some distortion noise was there for the half of the show.

I was provided a code for the event and it did not apply at time of purchase, no one on any side helped and just said too bad there is nothing we can do. The ticketmaster help chat sat idle for 4 hours

Review.Titre: Accessible seating being sold to people who don’t require accessible seats
Review.Contenu: We needed an accessible seat and were told they were sold out in March.  Very odd since I had found one on the Ticketmaster website a couple days prior only to have an unexpected error come up and ended up losing the ticket and could not get it back.  Bought regular tickets and saw people in the the accessible seating not needing accessible seats as we witnessed people coming and going through that section.  Very upsetting

Review.Titre: A number of things were frustrating
Review.Contenu: A number of things were frustrating. We paid an ungodly amount for the tickets and were sitting next to people that paid half of what we did who also ordered through Ticketmaster and didn’t purchase last minute through another party. They were supposedly VIP tickets, but other people in the section did not know it was a VIP thing. It was also annoying that our tickets were left at will call rather than being sent electronically which just wasted us time on the day of. I would rather save the $15 on free merchandise and have that money to purchase something that I actually wanted from the tour.

Review.Titre: I don't like that I had to install the…
Review.Contenu: I don't like that I had to install the app in order to show my tickets. I try to use Ticketmaster as little as possible and really don't want another app that I rarely use.

Review.Titre: I hope Ticketmaster apologizes for their years of terrible service and gets out of the business
Review.Contenu: Ticketmaster is by far the worse company I’ve ever dealt with. You gouge people with fees, have terrible customer service, make it practically impossible to get any kind of live support and to top it off, you can no longer get a printed version of a ticket (many of us have collected them for years). I cannot wait for Ticketmaster to die a painful death just like the pain you’ve caused your customers.

Review.Titre: I was extremely disappointed to see the…
Review.Contenu: I was extremely disappointed to see the cost of my tickets went from $135 /ea to $60 /ea closer to concert time. I reached out to the agent at the stadium and said at least move me to a seat that is equal to current value as they were available and was told no. Super dissapointed as I paid $270 for 2 tickets that went to $120. My friend paid just under $200 for the floor.

This was such a bad experience for anyone that likes and grew up with the Price is RightI actually find it hard to believe that they are really affiliated with the showThe ticket sales probably brought in 500K and they probably gave away maybe 10K in total. In the showcase final they showed a scooter, a couple of trips and a nice new red SUV  then the host said if you get the price right within 100$ you win it all. What a jokeI would never recommend this show don’t tarnish your Price is Right memories with a show that’s just a money grab

When I purchased my tickets in section 103, row A was supposed to be the first row. No tickets were available below A and that's exactly why I had chosen them. I had already bought tickets in a higher row and those in A were released later. I had to pay a fee which I wouldn't have had to pay if the tickets in A had been available as soon as the show went on sale. When I got to the venue, I saw that the tickets below us had just been released, so we ended up being in the 5th row. We would have gotten the tickets in row CC in the first place if they had been available. I think this is unfair.

Review.Titre: Changed the concert after I bought ticket
Review.Contenu: I didn't because I bought the ticket when it was supposed to be Exile tribe from Japan but ended up being someone I had no interest of. I got the insurance they offer to get my money back but I never got my money back.

Review.Titre: Hands-down the worst customer experience ever
Review.Contenu: Bought tickets for a show. Received tickets that said “restricted view” on them, which was never indicated when I was choosing the seats.I contacted Ticket MAster immediately. They wanted me to pay an additional fee to change the seats, which I refused to do. If they had merely changed my seats without trying to charge me more money I would’ve been happyI wanted simply cancel the order since they sent me restricted view tickets that I didn’t want. A few days of discussions back-and-forth and they still felt that this was an unreasonable request. They absolutely refused a refund.It was not possible to return the electronic tickets to Ticket MAster and they refused to refund my money, so I was stuck with them.Fortunately, VISA agreed with me that this was a ridiculous situation and refunded my money and will be collecting it back from Ticket MAster on my behalf! I never want to buy a ticket from Ticket MAster again for the rest of my life!

The app (you know, the one you now force all users to use to even access the tickets?) is truly one of the worst I've seen in my life. Can't connect, download or do anything without it crashing. Plus you have to start again once you manage to make it work, as it keeps logging you off.
Stop charging 35% service fee on tickets. But you don't care because you still and will continue to do it.

Review.Titre: Prices triple, No Refunds, 40% resell markup
Review.Contenu: Ticket prices have tripled in the last 8 yrs. This is not due to performers or promoters, its because of Ticketmasters greed. Also, when reselling, TM marks up the price another 40%. This increase is not done by the reseller.And Scalper bots still get all the best seats. And the TM Fees are out of control! Add another 20-35% on for final price!

Review.Titre: Our seats were in handicapped session…
Review.Contenu: Our seats were in handicapped session in under a overhang with a TV to watch as view from seat didn't allow viewing of game.I asked th change them and was given handicapped in the third tier.This was her first time and a 😖 bad experience.
2 hours pre-heat with random DJ on the stage and then just about 1 hour of the actual concert including breaks for t-shirt give-aways, this just doesnt worth 250$, sorry NO

Review.Titre: within 3 blocks of venue - stuck for over 30 min
Review.Contenu: We got to within 3 blocks to venue at 7:40 pm and traffic stopped. It took until 8:25 pm to get to parking, only to be told parking is all full. We ended up parking at University parking (hoping we would not get towed) and got inside to show at 8:45 pm. The show was great! Hopefully we did not miss alot of the songs.

Review.Titre: No Disability Accommodations or Customer Service
Review.Contenu: Ticketmaster's monopoly has led to a complete lack of customer care and service, where no one in the company seems to know anything anymore.  I used Concert Cash to buy a seat for a show to downgrade myself from standing GA due to injury, with the plan of selling the GA to a friend. Because their system glitched, I bought a seat for the wrong night. Ticketmaster refused to allow me to swap for the identical seat on the correct night even though this would cost them nothing. They refused to issue me a gift card that I was happy to use ON THE PHONE to buy the correct seat.  Instead I was told I could have an exception refund and get new Concert Cash.... only whoops, sorry, turns out we can't.  So I was left with no ticket, no $50 off, nada.  Ended up not seeing the show at all since I still had to sell the GA.  Had they just been FORTHRIGHT I would have sold the mistake GA and bought the correct one?  I'm so tired of their misdirects and lies while acting like they're doing you a favour even allowing you, the lowly public, to have a ticket at all.  If we had a choice we'd happily go elsewhere.

Nothing wrong with Ticketmaster. But parking is impossible, even in a venue that only holds around 4,000. Even an hour in advance.  It is also impossible to find a map of downtown St. Catherine's, so if you park somewhere you may not find your way back to. At night. Female.  I found a parking lot,but they only allow cash plus some app I never heard of. Within half an hour it was pandemonium. Worse than old Quebec City.  I drove all the way back to Hamilton without seeing anything.The trick is to arrive at 6 and go for dinner, with a very long string. You won't be alone.

The gal who opened up, she literally talked for 20 mins (i timed her). I get it that she has to thank all that donated, but 20 mins? it dragged on too long and the guests surrounding me thought same.                               And I didnt realize David would only preform for 50 mins. I wouldnt have paid $167 x 2 tickets had i known. Sorry but you asked

Review.Titre: Too many emails and notifications about…
Review.Contenu: Too many emails and notifications about the game. I do not need multiple communication per day. Before and after thd game. Very annoying!

Review.Titre: Resale tickets and peoples greed are…
Review.Contenu: Resale tickets and peoples greed are ruining events for regular people.  Ticketmaster needs to put a stop to resale tickets or come up with a better way to do things.  It is getting to be ridiculous.  My daughter can't see T Swift because people want to line their pockets. This world sucks!!!

Tickets couldn't be transferred for some reason so it was a pain to get all of my friends into the show. For all of the fees I paid I should at least be able to distribute the tickets to my friends easily.

Review.Titre: Traffic at the stadium was awful
Review.Contenu: Traffic at the stadium was awful. The on-site parking was shut off due to royal winter fair. Parking was this impossible. My guests and I missed the entire first half.

Review.Titre: The seats I bought had an obstructed…
Review.Contenu: The seats I bought had an obstructed view. And no where in the description of the tickets did it say anything about an obstructed view. You couldn’t see any part of the ice surface from the seats

Review.Titre: Lauryn Hills show was supposed to start…
Review.Contenu: Lauryn Hills show was supposed to start at 8. It was about ten when she went on. She had a DJ and then came on, which was fine. But, it was beyond late at starting time. Then, she was playing ex factor at 10:55 or so and I hear Drake rapping. I was so excited, but it was a recording of Drake. So, it was mainly recorded music and the most exciting moment was a ruse.

Review.Titre: The tickets could not be transferred.
Review.Contenu: The tickets could not be transferred.The tickets were purchased and then could not be used by the intended user because their phone was not current enough. Then the tickets could not be transferred from one Apple Wallet to another (both current iOS) without having a ticketmaster account. Attempts to access your help system was not helpful in solving the problem. Spent a week trying to resolve the issue only to have to get tickets printed at the box office on arrival. It was a very frustrating experience!

Review.Titre: Poor choice of venue and shorter than expected
Review.Contenu: Venue did not have good seating unless you were on the main floor. Seating price should reflect the obstructed views. The length of the show did not make it a valuable family outing; a longer show with an intermission would have been excusable for the cost.

Review.Titre: The show (Trans Siberian Orchestra) was fantastic!
Review.Contenu: The show (Trans Siberian Orchestra) was awesome.  Loved it. Getting into the venue (Scotiabank Arena) however, was not fun.  The passageway from Union Station to the Arena was jam packed with people and you couldn't move.  Someone going from Jurassic Park to Union Station was faced with wall-to-wall people and had to fight their way through.  Is there a way to have people lined up in an orderly fashion that would allow people to walk through without a battle?

The app was not working well for me. To begin, there were $13 in fees for each ticket that I bough which greatly increased the total cost. Then when I tried logging into the app it would not accept my password and kept saying error. After logging in online (with my same password) it then let me into the app (seems weird that I'd need to do it on my laptop first just to be able to use the app). When I got logged into the app, I clicked events and it was not showing me the tickets I had purchased, after trying again later, I could finally view the tickets but was unsuccessful in saving them to my Apple wallet. It was not until the day of the concert that I could actually get the tickets saved onto my phone. I'm just glad that in the end I was able to use it as intended, but it definitely should not have been so frustrating, especially since I'm paying so many fees.

The TSO concert was superior, couldn't have asked for a better group of extraordinarily talented musicians to watch and listen to. The issue was with the people who were responsible for getting us from the Go station into the  Scotiabank Arena, A NIGHTMARE. They were completely unprepared for us and it took over 40 minutes to get in, when it's a few minute walk from the Go. I've never walked in so many ridiculously long lines going no where, it was so poorly managed. Absolutely terrible. Then to add insult to injury, we were charged $10 for a bag of popcorn, $7 for a bottle of water and $17 for a beer...unforgivable! We will find other affordable music venues like Chudleighs in Milton who hosts great cover bands and charge $7.95 a beer. They want people to enjoy an affordable night and not feel pillaged like we did. There's no rationale to overcharge at the level this venue charges, it's beyond excessive.

Review.Titre: Your site is definitely not senior…
Review.Contenu: Your site is definitely not senior friendly. It took us two days to figure out your system and what happens when a senior doesn’t have a cell phone, they can’t attend any event as you cannot print out tickets?? Not everyone one is tech savy so you need to bring back actual tickets.

The seats were horrible. I purchased early and had a lot of choice. I would have expected Ticketmaster would have information on the configuration of the stage. I saw the side of a wall on the stage and was under the jumbo screens so saw nothing. It was very disappointing.  I could have chosen cheaper seats and had a way better view. I looked at Seattle tickets last night and the seats where you can’t see are sold out and the better seats that are cheaper are still available which tells me Ticketmaster doesn’t know the seats are completely inadequate. These seats should not be sold especially if the event is not sold out.

Review.Titre: I always have trouble navigating the…
Review.Contenu: I always have trouble navigating the TicketMaster site and finding my tickets online.  I much prefer paper tickets.

Review.Titre: The fees are too expensive too many fees there…
Review.Contenu: The fees are too expensive there gouging people to use their service shame on them Used to be reasonable, but it sure isn’t anymore and if I had another choice, I wouldn’t use Ticketmaster their fees are too high

The show itself was excellent, but the ticketmaster fees are ridiculous!  Nearly 1/5 the price of an already high priced ticket...and when I attempted to resell one ticket for someone that couldn't make the show, they keep the service fees but apply them again on resale?!  Absolute scam, I don't understand how the regulators allow this monopoly to continue.

Review.Titre: I was finally able to get tickets to a…
Review.Contenu: I was finally able to get tickets to a show I was interested in going to. I don't like how many verified resales instantly pop up right after something goes on sale. To me, this is not the way people who love to go to shows are treated. This is how people who want to make money off of people like me are favoured.
Your app says to update chrome in order to access my tickets.Chrome is up to date.So essentially the app does not work.Both ticket master app and chrome app are up to date.

Review.Titre: Ticketmaster overcomplicates the ticket buying experience
Review.Contenu: The show was great but this is the first time I've used Ticketmaster in a long time and it was way too convoluted. You had to get an app or put in a google wallet. I just want to print my ticket. What if my phone died? I wouldn't be able to get in. Ticketmaster just make the whole process more difficult.
Very difficult site to navigate and follow. Likely due to too much info. I’ll choose a different way to buy my tickets next time.
I purchased the premium parking and didn’t know where to go for parking….I felt that I was sucked in as a consumer as I wasn’t able to use it. Perhaps consider providing parking location details.

Review.Titre: Stop dynamic pricing and handling fees
Review.Contenu: Handling fees (which are higher now that everything is computerized than when we had to go to a counter and deal with human beings) and dynamic pricing are a big reason why I go see less shows than I used to. It’s becoming way too expensive. Pretexting a way stop scalpers but making a platform on which Ticketmaster resells their tickets and taking additional fees on them is ridiculous.Ticketmaster being a monopoly is a huge problem and a nuisance to the industry.The shows themselves are good but Ticketmaster has really no input into that part.

Review.Titre: Purchase of tickets AND entry to the concert was a HASSLE!
Review.Contenu: When purchasing the tickets, everything went smoothly up until the moment of payment where it didn't work because I entered a landline for the phone number. There was no indication that there would be a text message sent to this number in order to proceed and complete the purchase of the tickets. I entered the landline phone number to match the credit card of the person purchasing the tickets, but had no idea that the code required to complete the purchase of the tickets would be sent via text message to this number. So we had to go back and start the whole process over again and the second time the seats we had initially booked were no longer available. This was because those seats were not showing up as available due to OUR OWN previous order attempt for those specific seats. We were panicking since there were hardly any options with 4 seats together for our party of 4. After waiting several minutes with frequent refreshing (and having another family member helping us look for tickets on another computer), FINALLY our same seats that we had booked the first time finally popped up as being available again. The system for entry is finicky and discriminatory. The fact that people can't print out their tickets and bar codes in advance and that entry requires a smart phone is discriminatory. My husband dropped me off with our 2 kids (8 and 10) and went to park so we wouldn't have to walk so far and so we wouldn't be late because of all the traffic (pretty-much stopped). So we were entering separately from my husband, who had access to the tickets through his account. Such a hassle that I couldn't have printed out our tickets at home or that he couldn't just send me a screen shot of the bar code for us to enter, but he had to send me the link to his account AND send me his pw because I have to be actively logged in to his account to show a "moving" bar code. I only recently obtained a small amount of monthly data on my phone; I used to have NO DATA on my phone. What if this concert took place only a short time ago when I didn't have any data on my phone and therefore I couldn't enter on my own with our kids? We would've had to wait 20-30 min outside in the pouring rain for my husband to FIND US AND JOIN US (no easy task in a huge crowd outside the building)! I personally know people who don't have smart phones (only a flip phone with no data), and couples who share one cell phone between the two of them, and this system does not take into consideration these types of people. People might be coming from different locations than the other members of their party. Or what if the battery died on someone's phone? So many potential obstacles! As we were entering, we got stuck behind some people in line who were having trouble with bringing up some of the bar codes on their phone (scanned for only one member in their party but not the rest) while people in the other lines moved quickly ahead. Did I mention it was a torrential downpour and my phone is not waterproof either? I want to have my phone ready, with the moving barcode ready to go, but I also don't want my phone to die from getting wet in the rain. The concert tickets were a gift to our kids from the grandparents, but it's good we took them to the concert instead of the grandparents. I doubt the grandparents would even have been able to get in with all the fancy tech required for entry. Please take into consideration that not everyone who wants to attend a concert has the latest smart phone with all the bells and whistles and data to go with it.

Review.Titre: Le son beaucoup trop fort au point…
Review.Contenu: Le son beaucoup trop fort au point qu’on ne pouvait entendre les paroles.
The music was too loud.  The main performer spent too much time in the crowd & a fan monopolized her far too long.  We went to enjoy the show & the performers not to listen all about this fan, etc.
It is disappointing that Ticketmaster allows resale of tickets on their platform at highly inflated prices.  We used to call this scalping.  But it seems to be common practice today

Nothing wrong with the show, any staff, or likewise.  I think my biggest gripe with ticketmaster is your inability to play fair, and by that I mean by selling tickets to other sites before they go on sale to the public, which allows those groups to sell those tickets at a much higher price.

When I got to The Venue to have my ticket barcode scanned on the ticketmaster site, all I was seeing was black where the barcode should have been. The ticket person suggested turning dark mode off on my phone but that did not help. Had to go to the ticket office and they ultimately transferred my ticket to my friend who was with me. I wish I could have just had a PDF to print or show on my phone as an alternative. It took us 10 minutes to get into the venue once we got to the ticket person to sort out these technical difficulties. Using the Ticketmaster app instead it's not an option for me. I honestly wonder how people who don't have smartphones are expected to get into concerts these days. I was unable to find any solutions for people who don't have access to a smartphone to get into the venue.

Review.Titre: Don't be pregnant if you are dealing with Ticketmaster…
Review.Contenu: I had several problems getting the tickets online, I finally got them and realized after the purchase that the system had defaulted to the wrong section. Standing section and my pregnant daughter-in-law was one of our group. I called Ticketmaster and was told I would have to pay $40 in fees to get the tickets corrected.  Not impressed at all!

Review.Titre: Bought row 2 tickets in the upper bowl
Review.Contenu: Bought row 2 tickets in the upper bowl. Didn’t realize that row 1 wasn’t sold at all in the upper bowl and people walked in front of us the whole game blocking our view. Then people came and sat in row 1 obliviously not their seat and chain smoked cigarettes the rest of the game. Ushers/security looked over and came by a bunch of times and never did anything about it. We even asked the usher to do something and then just laughed at us.

Review.Titre: I have bought several tickets from…
Review.Contenu: I have bought several tickets from Ticketmaster.  The hockey tickets for Scotiabank are the worst.  When you go to purchase 2 tickets in a row and there are 3 seats left; the program will not let you purchase the 2 tickets because there is a seat left open.  Not my problem, I just want 2 of the 3 seats.  You really need to fix the problem.  I had no problem getting tickets for Cirque.

Followed instructions received in response to a question(System (Ticketmaster CA)Oct 12, 2023, 15:32 GMT+1(15:31:54) John Mark Verde Ceballos: Hi Joan, this is Mark. When you add your tickets to Apple Wallet it only shows one. However, you can tap it at the entrance 4 times because you have 4 tickets. Please be advised also that there would be no barcode for tickets in a digital wallet. If in case you are having difficulties accessing your tickets on the Day of the event, you may go to the Resolution Window located normally near the venue’s main entrance, for assistance on your mobile tickets. Just make sure to show them your credit card used in purchasing the tickets, Valid ID, and order number (44-54259/QUE).)but wallet only scanned once.  Had to step away with my friends and find the original tickets with bar codes before getting back in line to have them scanned.  At my age (83) this is especially annoying!

Review.Titre: My tickets arrived just in time
Review.Contenu: My tickets did not arrive within 10-14 days before the event as Ticketmaster specified they would.  I attempted to use the ChatBot and all it did was repeat the information on My Tickets page.  I tried every day for a week.  I was finally connected to a real person (I think).  But all she did was reiterate what it said on the My Tickets page.  My tickets arrived 7 days before the event.

Review.Titre: My passes for my Apple wallet were…
Review.Contenu: My passes for my Apple wallet were disabled again, was refused entry until I went online and used the Ticketmaster website. Guess I’ll have to give up on the wallet from now on.

Review.Titre: Subcharge of 84$ for a kiss army…
Review.Contenu: Subcharge of 84$ for a kiss army membership that I don’t need and give absolutely nothing it’s really frustrating.

Second NFC ticket did not work on the ticket scanner. Thankfully the venue person let the second person in despite this. Needing to get the tickets on phone (instead of any device) and not being able to share the nfc for other people beyond one phone did not help either. Please bring back screenshotable barcodes for people who have a history of not scalping or doing shady things.Also like a third of the final price is ticketmaster processing fees, which is a lot with respect to the foothold ticketmaster has on the market. Plus considering one ticket didn't work, technically I paid for processing of nothing for one of them.

I know it wasn’t titled “festival”, but anything related to the Rocky Horror Picture Show should be obnoxiously over the top. This event was most definitely NOT that. It seemed under-planned and half-assed. The local acting folks didn’t even know their lines! Zero merch. Badly planned costume contest. No food. Made guests pay for “prop bags” for the show. Very disappointing all around.

It was not apparent before I purchased a parking pass for my BIL that I would not be able to transfer it. I received less than stellar help from the customer service at ticketmaster who could not help me at all.

My husband uses a walker. We had lovely seats at the theatre but parking was a nightmare. We paid $50 for ‘accessible parking. After 9 levels we finally found a spot, not accessible. Parking is in a separate building from the theatre and a very long walk. Then when we left the parking lot, the attendant at the exit said parking was free! Ticketmaster sold parking bundled with the event and it was misleading and most inconvenient.
More information should have been available for the VIP meet and greet.

Review.Titre: Terrible acoustics, Challenging Visual, Frustrating Delays
Review.Contenu: The acoustics were so distorted that I couldn’t make out the words, it was very hard to follow along at all.The show started 1.5 hours late and although there was a DJ mixing songs, I feel we should have been informed of the change in timing by the DJ. From my seats, I could not see the screen due to the big speakers placed in front. When you cant hear or see properly and you are waiting for 90 minutes, it made for a very frustrating night. I had spent 6 hours that day, travelling for this concert and I eventually was frustrated enough to leave early. If I hadn’t done so, I would have missed the last subway and my time would have stretched longer then 7 hours, I left being thankful of that but not happy about the concert at all.

Queen + Adam Lambert were great. I would love to see them again, but without any obstruction! When I purchased my tickets, I was not aware that there would be a giant cable that would be right in the middle of my view of the stage. The cable was hanging from a light scaffold extending to the control centre. I had brought my two daughters for the show too, and I was disappointed that their first experience at a concert at Scotiabank had this giant cable. It's too bad I can't include pictures in this review. I definitely will not be buying tickets in the future in section 303, Row 3.

Review.Titre: I bought a set of four tickets and…
Review.Contenu: I bought a set of four tickets and could not buy a fifth ticket adjacent to our seats without buying another set of four. There was no one sitting next to either side of us at the event and these seats could have been sold as a single ticket at least a day or two prior to the event date if there were no takers for a set of four leading up to the event dates.

I accidentally clicked on Quebec City rather than Toronto when ordering Andre Rieu tickets. I called to report it and the agent said "Just resell them closer to the date" But when the time came, Ticketmaster would not accept resales for that concert. Disappointing.

My group was extremely disappointed in this musical, for the fact that it was advertised as an English play with portions in French. In reality, the entire musical was in French, with the exception of the songs. We did not understand anything that was being said, which made for a very boring performance. I heard the advertisement for this musical on an English only radio station, where it was promoted entirely in English. The description on the ticket was described in English, and no where in the advertising did it say this was a French musical. We were very mislead.

Review.Titre: I would like to be able to print my ticket
Review.Contenu: I would like to be able to print my tickets.

Review.Titre: Tickets were not pitch side as indicated when purchased
Review.Contenu: When I purchased the tickets it indicated they were pitch side. At the ground it was apparent they were not, in fact about 30 rows up from pitch side!
